creator: henry@corpmart.com
text:
For an included page B from page A, having a line to forward the content onto a 
next page C will case the following error:

ERROR: can't find default error handler or error in default error page
ERROR: can't find default error handler or error in default error page
java.lang.StackOverflowError

i.e.
page A include page B
page B forward to page C

Page A loads page B successfully. However, page B tried to include/forward to 
page B again, instead of page C. Then the included page B tries to 
include/forward to page B again and again, leading to StackOverflowError.

This problem is rather important. The Tomcat process dies when this 
StackOverFlow error happens. All requests to the server will not be entertained 
thereafter.
creator: henry@corpmart.com
nacho@apache.org
text:
Test against Tomcat 3.3 ( Beta2 or CVS ) .., it seems the initial problem has 
gone, but i'm not sure if it's already solved .. For me seems some output is 
lost ...

AFAIK this is fixed in 3.3. I added explicit code at the container level to
limit the depth of includes - so StackOverflow shouldn't happen ( for this
reason ). Any servlet can generate a StackOverflow ( easily ), so if the
container dies, the VM has a big bug in it ( because any servlet can bring it
down ), you should change the VM.

I've tested your app in 3.3 and it works fine.
